column4: All, trying to add manually the MySQL extension to my php.ini file.  What do I run find for?
All am I looking for .so or .dll?
you dont need to that manually on ubuntu, you just need to install the mysql php module package
Been trying but always get error.
sudo apt-get install php5-mysql
you do not need to edit your php.ini
You keep jumping in here and don't have full story "apt-get install php5-mysql" errors with errors at PB: http://pastebin.ca/1266663.  If you have loggin on look at the log.
so please stop creating another problem, you are not expected to edit your php.ini untill you fix that error
there is no error on that pastebin, it's just a sources.lst
Quote ==> "TbotNik, you do not need to edit your php.ini"  Great but doing find on system show no supporting files, so edit of php.ini will not suffice.
because the package already setups itself on the php
installing php+mysql on Ubuntu is not Windows
Sorry wrong PB it is:  http://pastebin.ca/1266671
apt-cache search php5 mysql
that package is available form the regular repositories, so there is something wrong with your repositories configuration
Quote ==> "TbotNik, apt-cache search php5 mysql" command "apt-cache search php5 mysql" produces nothing.
sudo apt-get update
Did you find right error PB?
make sure your apt-get update is successful
Do I need to run the apt-get install --upgrade?
no, first you need to sudo apt-get update
All the mirrors are erroring on the apt-get update
ok, so you find your problem, your repositories are failing to update :)
Looks like it need to change resource mirrors in /etc/apt/sources.list, but to what?
